name: run-salesforce-code-analyzer-dev
description: Runs Salesforce Code Analyzer v5 against PRs or full branches and enforces violation thresholds.
author: Sam Crossland
helpMarkDown: Can run on PRs and find the changed files, or full branches, checking for code quality violations.

inputs.name: extensionsToScan
inputs.label: File extensions to scan (pipe-delimited)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Pipe-delimited list of file extensions to include in the scan (e.g., cls|trigger|html)

inputs.name: stopOnViolations
inputs.label: Stop build if violations exceed maximum (true/false)
inputs.helpMarkDown: If true, the build will fail when the number of violations exceeds the threshold.

inputs.name: useSeverityThreshold
inputs.label: Use severity threshold instead of maximum violation count
inputs.helpMarkDown: If enabled, the build fails when violations meet/exceed a severity threshold. Otherwise, it fails on total violations.

inputs.name: severityThreshold
inputs.label: Severity Threshold (fail on >=)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the severity threshold to fail the build on if any violations hit/exceed it.

inputs.name: maximumViolations
inputs.label: Maximum Allowed Violations
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail the build if total violations exceed this number (irrespective of severity).

inputs.name: configFilePath
inputs.label: Code Analyzer configuration filepath
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional absolute path to a custom Salesforce Code Analyzer configuration file (e.g ./config/code-analyzer.yml) - more detail here 'https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/platform/salesforce-code-analyzer/guide/config-custom.html'

inputs.name: ruleSelector
inputs.label: Rule selector arguments (e.g Recommended, eslint, pmd, etc)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional '--rule-selector' arguments, which defaults to Recommended (a tag across multiple engines), but can be customised as per here 'https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/platform/salesforce-code-analyzer/guide/analyze.html#run-the-rules-on-your-code-base'

inputs.name: postStatusCheckToPR
inputs.label: Post status check to PR (true/false)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Boolean to dictate whether we POST an extra status check to the source PR. Requires setting 'env: SYSTEM_ACCESSTOKEN: $(System.AccessToken)' in your pipeline yml.

inputs.name: postCommentsToPR
inputs.label: Post comments to PR (true/false)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Boolean to dictate whether we POST comments to the PR. Requires setting 'env: SYSTEM_ACCESSTOKEN: $(System.AccessToken)' in your pipeline yml.

inputs.name: scanFullBranch
inputs.label: Scan full branch vs PR-only
inputs.helpMarkDown: Boolean to dictate whether we're doing a full branch scan for the entire codebase, or only on valid PRs
